author: Special Correspondent
text:
A court in Goa on Friday adjourned to Tuesday the arguments on the anticipatory bail petition of pop star Remo Fernandes in a child verbal abuse case. Goa Children’s Court judge Vandana Tendulkar allowed an application filed by complainant and lawyer Aires Rodrigues seeking his intervention in the bail petition so as to place material facts before the court.

The court will also hear on Tuesday arguments on Mr. Rodrigues’s petition that it monitor the investigation.

Meanwhile, Mr. Fernandes, who arrived in Goa from Portugal, filed an affidavit along with his bail application, saying the thrust in his music was on the fight against corruption, drugs, exploitation of women and other ills that afflicted Goa and India. Mr. Fernandes said he is widely known for his involvement in cultural, social and political events in Goa designed to bring about a change in society.

On a complaint from Mr. Rodrigues, the north Goa police registered an FIR under Section 8 of the Goa Children’s Act, 2003, against Mr. Fernandes.

Mr. Fernandes is accused of having verbally abused a 17-year-old girl from Malvan in Maharashtra.
title: Remo’s bail plea hearing adjourned to Tuesday
